Gunman kills 1, wounds 8
at Empire State Building

Two law enforcement officials said a recently fired store worker shot a former colleague to death and then randomly opened fired on others. (AP, 11:06 a.m.)

Armstrong to get lifetime ban, lose titles

The US Anti-Doping Agency said it will strip Lance Armstrong of his seven Tour de France titles after he dropped his fight against drug charges that threatened his legacy as one of the greatest cyclists of all time. (AP)

A look at melting polar ice caps

 
BOTTOM: NASA/March 17, 2008
TOP: NASA/Feb. 28, 2008

Greenland's ice has melted over a larger area than at any time in more than 30 years of observations. See how the melting landscape has changed across the globe.

T bus driver attacked by man who was left behind at Wonderland stop

The driver was punched and kicked by a passenger who became irate when the driver pulled away without picking him up, Transit Police said. (Globe, 9:56 a.m.)

13 shot in 30 minutes in Chicago

Police say 13 people were shot and wounded in a 30-minute spate of violence in Chicago, including eight people gunned down on a single street. Authorities have been battling an increase in homicides in the city.
